name: Samuel Steele
text: I had the worst experience with Dr. Habermacher, I had went to ER with a kidney stone and was told it measured 7mm, was told to follow up with Urologist from your clinic,I saw NP on day of appointment which was very nice,I ask for a scan to be done before so we would know if stone was still there. The morning of surgery, Dr. Habermacher came into room I ask if he was going to do scan to make sure stone was gone, he replied no, it will be gone today one way or another. I had passed very small pieces of stone but definitely not a 7mm in prior week.When I awoke from procedure I was told there was no stone, after getting home I was very sick from procedure and very sore. I went for my follow-up, I told the girl that checked me in that I was upset that he did not do KUB to make sure the stone was gone also, that I am a nurse and have had enough of kidney stone patients to know how to check for kidney stones and I definitely had not passed a 7mm. She said I will tell him, she immediately came back in room and said this is a nurse visit, he wants you to do 24 hr urine and come back in 2 months. I have no intentions of ever using him again, why would you not do a KUB or scan to make sure it's gone before putting someone through this, it sounds like it's all about money to me. WILL NEVER use this Dr again.

name: Nathan Herrick
text: Received a referral from my insurance company to this clinic to see a Gastroenterologist and I cannot even schedule an appointment. For the last two months, I have called the only available phone number to make an appointment only to be transferred to the gastroenterology clinic appointment line where I have left several messages with the scheduler because that person was not there. No return calls and the office is closed on Friday.

resp.text: Nathan, we would value the opportunity to connect with you further. Our patient care team can be reached at (334) 613-7070 at your convenience. If you would prefer to speak with our Patient Advocate, please call (334) 568-4866.

name: Renae Pemberton
text: I would not recommend anyone to Dr. Habermacher. My husband and I received some news that was scary and the doctor was not empathetic towards us. He does not like for his patients to do any scholarly research to help the patient or families to be knowledgeable on their diagnosis. He will get offended if you ask questions in which he feels a patient is second guessing his medical knowledge. He talked down to us and no doctor should ever talk to people in that way. Listen to your gut or in my case the Holy Spirit if something does not sit right with you about someone taking care of your loved one. I pray Dr. Habermacher is a Christian and if not that he will come to know the love of Jesus.

resp.text: Renae, we would value the opportunity to connect with you further. Our patient care team can be reached at (334) 613-7070 at your convenience.

name: Abby McNeil
text: I’ve been a patient of dr garg for a little over a year and she’s great . Yesterday I came in and I just wanted to call out one of the endocrinology nurses , Jennifer , and tell her how kind and wonderful I thought she was at her job. Jennifer went out of her way to make sure I was comfortable during a really long glucose test I had . Dr garg also takes a whole body approach to your treatment , and it is truly worth my drive from Dothan where all our endos are retiring/booked to come to this clinic .

resp.text: Abby, thank you for the kind review. It is our honor to provide excellence in care to the people of Alabama!

name: Jaime Denise
text: They schedule way too many people at the same time, so the waiting time is HOURS.

resp.text: We understand your concerns and know that your time is valuable. Your feedback has been shared with our team and we thank you for your patience in this intricate season of care.

name: Tony Boyer
text: At times finding proper care that gives you the feeling your best interest has been top priority can be a challenge in the Montgomery area.  We typically go to Birmingham for peace of mind.  My first visit to UAB Urology clinic was one of the best experiences I've had anywhere.  Professional, engaging, reflective, and not reluctant to challenge the knowledge and awareness of their patients.  Dr. Habermacher understood my level of comprehension to quickly lend understanding to my concerns & how to handle my own personal health going forward.  Without being too long winded, I have to express gratitude for the opening and benefits of this clinic for Montgomery residents & anyone within reasonable distance.  Checks all the boxes both physically and psychologically to assure patients care is their top priority.

name: Jeff chappell
text:
Apparently negative reviews get taken down quickly?  Dr. Thudi, an endo, has the worst communication skills.  Does not listen, assumes, and is too proud to admit mistakes.  They return calls, but only if you're waiting by the phone.  No voicemails except "please call us back" and you never get a live person, so it's voicemail tag over and over and over.  Add that to their "never on Friday" rules and you've got a setup for making money with zero customer service, much less patient service.
And DON'T even think of adding a response to this about "We'd like to talk with you about your experience".  We spoke, we emailed, and THIS IS my response to your customer care.  Don't act like this is the first you have heard of the problem.

name: Evelyn Young
text: I have had zero problems until today. You have one number for the entire clinic. They have several specialists. So it is hard to reach the person you need. I called asking for a specific person and extension. I was asked the person last name .They did not leave a last name. I gave the extension#. I was asked what is the nature of the call. I still did not get the person that left the message. Guess if it's important they will call me back..

name: Tamra Oswalt
text:
I'm very disappointed I have been to four doctors in the past month about my foot and my toe I am in excruciating pain mobic is helping and your office closed at noon today because it's Friday well I don't consider an emergency other than I'm excruciating pain and can't walk. So what am I supposed to do?

Very disappointed how the doctor he's never seen me going to know what to do for me

name: Scott Thompson
text:
Originally given 1-star: Waited for 6 weeks for an appointment just to have a consult. The Friday before the Monday afternoon appointment I get a call saying Doctor Hablemacker would be out of the office and they had rescheduled me for two weeks later in the morning instead of the original afternoon. They required me to call and confirm to keep the new appointment. No further explanation. No options given for the inconvenience. Attempted to call at 2:30 pm when I got the message, but the office was already closed. Apparently they also don’t work on Friday afternoons...

UPDATE TO POST (10/18): Upgraded to 2-star.The office was able to accomidate a different appointment time since I was going to be out of the country during their first rescheduled time. Initially, they didn't have availability, but were willing to squeeze me in for the short consult given the previous circumstances. I will reconsider again after the appointment/service.

resp.text:
Mr. Thompson,
We are very sorry we did not meet your expectations.  Please do call our office today between 8 AM and 5 PM to find a more convenient time for your appointment.

name: Grover Wedgeworth
text: Service sucks, no follow up on lab between visits, .Failed to provide consultation notes and labwork to my wife's primary doc.  Dtaff are curt cna rude

name: DeAndre Scott
text: I have been coming to the UAB Specialty clinic to see Rheumatology. Dr. Gadea and his staff are some of the best medical professionals I have ever come across. Having worked in the medical field for 16 years (21year USAF Vet), I have worked with countless professionals. I can only highly recommend Dr Gadea and his team as their patient care exceeds the standard every visit!

name: Wendy Adams
text: This is a poor excuse for a gastroenterology center. My husband is having issues with abdominal pain and other stomach issues and we were told by Dr. Kahn that if my husband continued to have issues that he should go back to the ER and let them call him and see if he could get in for an emergency colonoscopy. Well he went back to the ER and they ran all kinds of test and just because his blood work came back fine, the ER staff and Dr. Kahn refused to admit him and said that he would have to wait until Feb to have a colonoscopy scheduled.  So the doctor lied to both of us. Needless to say my husband is still in very bad pain. So nothing bad better happen to my husband because of their negligence.

name: Andrea Curtis
text: The doctors here are excellent.  I especially like Dr. Nina Jo Hibbard, Endocrinologist,  and Dr. Carlos Gadea, Rheumatologist.  They are knowledgable, patient, and very concerned about the pateient's well-being.    I wouldn't trust my healthcare needs to be handleded anywhere else.   😀

name: Jennifer van Arcken
text: My husband had surgery by Dr. Habermacher and we are very pleased that UAB opened this state of the art clinic in Montgomery and brought such great healthcare professionals to our area. The surgery was a success and the follow up visits at the clinic were accomplished very professionally.

name: Bill Flick
text: I have seen Dr. Pazona in Urology and found him to be very competent, professional and pleasant.  The staff were also very efficient and pleasant.

name: Tamara Dozier
text:
Dr. Mullins was wonderI!!
I need a new Rheumatologist ...

name: EDDIE SMITH
text: Great doctor took good care of my mother

name: David Bush
text: This is the most comfortable I have ever felt in a doctor's office. NP Ashley is amazing at truly listening to her patients. She has that gift of being sincere  about your concerns. The rest of the staff are also equally amazing. I highly recommend  this office

resp.text:
Hi David,

Thank you for the feedback. I will be sure to share with Ashley and staff!

name: Lesli Riley
text: My father had a colonoscopy with Dr. Garrett and developed enterococcus faecium. An infection from unsterilized colonoscopy equipment. He died from this

name: Wendy Coleman
text: I can't say that I have a single complaint.  Maybe,  the colonoscopy prep but that is nothing they can help.  Dr. Anderson is top of the line, hands down.  Jackie Shumate, the nurse practitioner, provides a comprehensive review and you are never rushed through an appointment.  She covers all issues with ideas, suggestions and solutions.  You definitely feel important and as if your health matters to them personally.  I highly recommend this office to anyone looking for a great practice.   They also practice social distancing.

resp.text:
Ms. Coleman,
Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is important to us. I will be sure to share your comments with the team!

name: Shalaya89
text:
Hello!
I can not get anyone to answer the phone or return my call from the voice message I have left several times. It always says you are assisting other patients l, but no one answers at all. Please help.

resp.text:
Shalaya,

I apologize that we were unable to answer your call today. Our office will return all messages with contact information provided by end of day. If you have not received a call back at this point please give me a call for assistance, I can help. Our office is open from 8am-4pm. 495.2600 ext 1000

name: Yulya Plaia
text: Really dissapointed. I have made an appointments with them 2 times and both had to be canceled the last min on their end. I had to have a breath test done and I drove 40 min only to get there and have them tell me that they can't do the test there. I called and confirmed that I still had the appointment with them a week prior to that. The nurse could have called me or emailed me and tell that. But unfortunately I drove all they way to Montgomery and didnt get anything out of it. I understand that its hard with this corona and stuff but they could have thought about their patients.

resp.text:
Yulya,

Thanks for taking the time to express your experience with our office. While we strive to meet the needs of every patient it’s clear we missed the mark here. I would like to discuss this with you in detail if time allows. 334.239.9257

Thanks ,
C. Butler, Practice Administrator

name: Ove
text: Terrible service. I understand the pandemic, but sitting in your car is ridiculous!! It took forever to get an appointment, only to be called and told the nurse was no longer seeing patients in the afternoon!! I was told to go to the East Trailer, yes a trailer, for a  colonoscopy and an egd! I've yet to see a physician to discuss my problem. Now I'm sitting in the car, had an 8:30 appointment, it is now 8:45. If I could get a referral for another Gastroenterologist, I'd be gone. Only problem, I'd have to start all over. Unless you can deal with pain, go somewhere else because I have been dealing with this issue for three months only to be told everything looks good, then why are my labs abnormal?

resp.text:
Thank you for your feedback.

The hospital has purchased trailers to help with UABs social distancing policy’s. These are uncharted waters and while we strive to make everyone comfortable during the pandemic, we understand improvements may be necessary. I would like to discuss your concerns further, when time permits.

Please give me a call 334.495.2600
Thanks,
Mrs. C. Butler

name: Jon Pridgen
text: I've been a patient of Dr. White's for over 15 years and have always been pleased with his care. I recently had a procedure with Dr. Garrett and she is equally compassionate and thorough as Dr. White. Both Jackie and Ashley have been exemplary as well. My parents also use Capital City Gastroenterology and have always received excellent care.

name: Rebecca Thomas
text: Great experience. The nurse practitioner was thorough and listened carefully. She did not waste time, but was professional and friendly. She set up good diagnostic tests and offered a variety of samples of medications to try for my health issues.

name: Sandra Gibson
text:
Dr. White is awesome.  He is so considerate of my feelings.
Nurse Practitioner Ashley does a great job and is so thorough and personable.

Caitlin is the greatest.  She needs extra pay for being my Psychiatrist

Office staff is very friendly

resp.text:
Ms. Gibson,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is important to us. I will be sure to share your comments with the team!

name: Jeremy Alphord
text: In November of 2019 I was overcharged $300 but have been unable to get my refund. If this were a past due bill I would have been sent to collections but they can just say it was a billing error and not return the money. Very disappointed with the service at this practice.

resp.text:
Jeremy,

I’m sorry to hear that you’ve had an issue with our billing dept. However Im available to discuss your concerns. If there is an overpayment a refund will be processed. Please contact me when time allows 334.495.2600 ext 1000.

Thanks,
Practice Admin

name: Alex Trott
text: Phenomenal, caring employees. Went above and beyond to make me comfortable, educate me, and make everything as easy as possible.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! I will be sure share.

name: sandra joiner
text: I highly recommend Jackie the nurse practitioner. She was so thorough, kind and helpful. She took so much time to help my husband with his health problems. I am very thankful for all that she did for us. All the staff was very courteous and helpful.

name: Ann Herman
text: Have always had a pleasant visit

name: Kimberly Starke
text: The staff is friendly and comforting.  I usually see Dr. Morrow and she's very easy to talk to for any questions.  I love seeing scripture in the rooms.  I've been using this office since 2017, when I switched from a Jackson Hospital gastroenterologist.

name: Judy Mills
text: I have been using Dr Penn White for a very long time. He has taken care of my medical needs and he explains what has to be done if anything is wrong. His staff is always nice. Theyi schedule appointments for other Dr's that he recommends that I go. I have seen Ashley several times and she has always been concerned with whatever is bothering me at the time. She wants to resolve the problem. I have always been pleased with Dr White and his staff.

name: Janice Jackson
text: Jackie Shumate is the greatest Nurse Practitioner! She's smart and she listens, then she prescribes what you need. I enjoy my visits with her. I'm glad she's Dr. Garrett's assistant.

name: Frank Rivers
text:
Ashley Marrow,NP. is seeing Dr. Penn  White patients apparently, but the procedures are at Babtist East Hospital, by Dr.White......
Very professional and very busy...
They work as a team, that's why I give them the 5 stars.
The office staff are top notch......

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! I will share with the group.

name: Brenda Pennington
text: NP Ashley Morrow was very thorough with me.  She was very polite and took the time to list to me.  I was very happy with my visit.

name: vanessa jones
text: Ashley Morris was wonderful. She took her time explaining things to me. She was very concerned and patient. The staff was very friendly.

name: L T
text: I thought I was finally in good hands here. Until I had a test done and I’ve tried calling the office for almost TWO weeks. Not one person has called back with my results or to let me know if my results are in. I even left a message with the office manager and they didn’t call me back. This is the most unprofessional doctors office I’ve ever been to & I finally thought I would get some answers as to what’s going on with my health. The nurse practitioner Amy (forgot her last name) was super sweet and spent time with me listening to me, but whoever answers the phone needs a one on one. Don’t go here if you’re looking for answers. Now I’m going to have to start all over.

resp.text:
LT,
My Name is Mrs. Butler and I am the Practice Administrator. I'm sorry to hear about your experience with our office. We're normally more timely, and I regret that we missed the mark. I would like to discuss this further, please contact me at 334.239.9257.

name: Debra Ashlock
text: I think the service is great, but the office rescheduled my appointment without calling me . As a heathcare worker, (I am a nurse) I understand the need to reschedule, but I have a job also, and would have appreciated a call to make the appointment when I could be off.

name: The Gary’s
text: I had a great visit. It was my first time and Jackie made me feel at ease. She was knowledgeable and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback!

name: Beautiful Stranger 125
text:
I had the pleasure of being treated by CRNP Jackie Shumate. She was very kind and informative. She answered all my questions and explained everything very thoroughly. The ladies up front and at checkout are so friendly and efficient.
I am so glad I was referred here.

name: Anita Rice
text: Dr Garrett has been with me through all my issues. In my opinion she's the best and I plan on her being my Gastrointestinal Doctor for as long as she will put up with me. She's traveled rough roads, ups and downs, she's a blessing

resp.text:
Ms. Rice,

Thank you for your feedback. I will be sure to share your review with Dr. Garrett.

Your feedback is appreciated!

name: Harold Schley
text: The Nurse Practitioner Ashley Morrow did a great job explaining my medical situation in a term that I could understand , thanks

name: Lula Clemons
text: Dr. Ashley is awesome she really listens an share her concerns is very professional. You are in an out in no time BLESSINGS TO DR. ASHLEY

name: Heather Terrell
text: NP Ashley Morrow is amazing. She didn't stop until she figured out what was going on with me. Everyone in the office is pleasant to speak with as well.

resp.text:
Ms. Terrell,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is important to us.

name: Alice Grayson
text: The staff is phenomenal! I had a 3:00 appointment and was with the doctor on time. I have never been in a more organized and time conscous office. Thank y'all!

name: Donna Prashad
text: Nurse practitioner Ashley is great. Makes you feel like you matter and she cares.

name: Michael Hardy
text: Dr Garrett was professional and thorough. I had seen her in the past and had the opportunity to see another gastroenterologist. I chose to wait longer to see Dr Garrett.  Capital City Gastroenterology is the best. 5 🌟.

name: Tammy Storms
text: Dr. Echols is a God sent. In November of 2017 she discovered two tumors and that I had colorectal cancer. She then sent me to an amazing surgeon in Birmingham named Dr. Blaine Bishop & he robotically removed them and I've done chemo and I was healed of that but then something else came about and I'm doing chemo again and I know again that I will be healed because my God is awesome!!! Back to the question... Dr. Echols staff and nurses are amazing and I don't know how they do it but they make you feel comfortable and believe me in the area of the body that they desl with that's pretty hard to do.😳

name: Norma Edwards
text: They are awesome and very caring I love ❤️ them all NP Ashley especially

name: Shirley Jones
text: Very personable but professional. Always seen in a timely manner.

name: Suzy Alabama
text: I saw the Physicians Assistant who was knowledgeable, patient, and kind.  5 stars

name: Vickie Yates Britt
text: All Staff very knowledgeable and helpful. PA listens and discusses situation.  Thankful to be referred to this group.

name: fran mathis
text: I have used Capitol city Gastrointestinal for years and love them they are so professional and kind

resp.text:
Ms. Mathis,

Thank you for your kind words and feedback regarding your ongoing experience.

It's appreciated!

name: Ron Stanton
text: My second visit to the office was just as impressive as the first visit. The staff was very professional and treated me like a relative, not a faceless customer.

resp.text:
Mr. Stanton,

Thank you for your feedback. Its appreciated!

name: Brenda Key
text: The staff at CCG is very professional, friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  Jackie was my nurse yesterday and she enlightened me on the name of what my condition was actually called.  If I had heard Esophagitis before yesterday, I didn’t recall it.  I was also concerned about the possibility of having a hiatal hernia and she relieved my worries about that as well by telling me that they saw no signs of that when they did the EGD.  So, I left feeling much better about my condition yesterday and have hopes of getting it “fixed” eventually through medication and their care.

name: Janyth Grimes
text: I have always been shown grace and dignity in what some including myself would consider a very uncomfortable office! I am very grateful for CRNP Ashley and Dr. Nelson-Garett! Even the front office staff is amazing! Thank you Capital City Gastro!

name: A P
text: Who cares what the practitioners are like if the front office staff lacks compassion, is blatantly rude, and unwilling to help with scheduling?

resp.text:
Amanda,
Thank you for sharing your experience. I would like to discuss your feedback when time permits. It is my hope that we will be able to  learn from this experience and address your concerns. Phone: 334.495.2600 ext 1000

Mrs. Butler

name: John Midkiff
text: Dr. Echols and her staff are the absolute best !! I was having some medical issues and needed help ASAP, Dr Echols went above and beyond to get me in for a appointment and had me at the Endoscopy Center within a 24 hour period. Dr. Echols immediately diagnosed my situation and began treatment which lead to almost instant relief. She is very thorough and explains your situation where you can understand what is going on and how it will be treated. Highly Recommend Dr. Heather Echols for your Gastro problems !!!

name: Sandra Sevcech
text: Great physician's, Great staff. Highly recommend this place!!!

name: Susan “SuSu” Driver
text:
Dr. Penn White and Practitioner, Ashley are knowledgable, caring and address all concerns-
excellent experience and group . Highly recommend.

name: Philip Howland
text: they are the best  dr garrett and ashley are are very professonal and caring

name: Lamar M
text: I had a great experience with this practice! Staff was friendly and helpful. My mom was treated with care and dignity from beginning to end.

name: Hubert Staley
text: Every staff member at CCG has been nothing but the best each time I have contacted the facility (either by telephone or office visit).  My latest appointment with Nurse Practitioner Ashley Morrow verifies my wholehearted satisfaction with CCG.  She was very patient, pleasant, and caring in responding to every question and/or concern I expressed.  I would not hesitate to recommend CCG to anyone, because the medical staff (Dr. Anderson and Ms. Morrow) have my complete confidence and respect, and all members of the office staff have always proven most helpful and friendly.

resp.text:
Mr. Staley

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. Your feedback is important to us. I will share your comments with the team!

name: Bo Jinright
text: They never answer the phone. They seem more interested in claims than care. It's taken months to get test results. Weeks to get callbacks. I'm still waiting 3 more months 6 total for an initial visit.

name: Joyce Wiles
text: I recently had to have an EGD because of a persistent cough and some difficulty swallowing pills. I had a consultation with CRNP, Jackie Shumate before the test and a couple of follow up visits with her to make sure the meds she prescribed were working for me. She is very knowledgeable and knew just what questions to ask me about my symptoms, but she is also very kind and concerned about my health issue. All the staff have been kind and friendly, as well. I would recommend CCG to anyone and would not hesitate to use them again.

resp.text:
Ms. Wiles,

Thank you for your open and honest feedback. I will be sure to share with the team here at CCG!

name: ed mcadory

text: I’ve Been Calling For A Month Now Trying To Get In Contact With Someone To Set An Appointment Ive Been In Pain And Need Some Assist And No One Answers But Y’all Are Opened !!!!!

Mr. Quimby,

name: Richard Pitts
text: Dr Anderson is excellent.  He takes time to talk to me about my health.

resp.text:
Mr. Pitts,

Thank you for your feedback!

name: Jill Philips
text: Interested, concerned, always learning as well as caring.

name: Felicia N.
text:
Dr. Anderson,
Treated my grandmother. She had surgery and died.
He told me I had a hernia. Went in to surgery for repair and he cut through my bladder. He had to call in a specialist to take care of it. I had permanent staples in my bladder.

He is not a good doctor when it comes to diagnosis and surgeries.

name: Sherilyn Morgan
text: Ashley, CNP, was very thorough, knowledgeable, actually listened, and was understanding

name: Robin Cutter
text: The staff and doctors are very professional and concern about their patients health

name: leona parker
text: Patient reviews kept me safe. I will not make an appointment.

name: Jenny Clark
text: Oh boy!  I had a very awful experience with one of the female doctors at this practice.  Personally, if you are considering this place, I would just run like H3LL.  I had symptoms of acid reflux and had an ENT confirm what I thought it was.  I asked to get an endo done just to ensure my throat did not have Barrett's.  They referred me for the procedure and one of the female doctor's performed the endo.  Prior to this I had never met this doctor.  I explained my acid reflux and she said it could be my gallbladder since I had a child 1.5 years prior.  She recommended an ultrasound and hyda scan.  I went in for both and it was found that I did have a gallstone.  The hyda scan was normal.  The gastro doc immediately referred me to a surgeon to have my gallbladder removed.  I was blown away!  I had never had any typical gallbladder attacks or pain.  After doing more research I found out that having your gallbladder removed can actually cause bile reflux due to the constant free flow of bile into your system once the gallbladder is removed and the bile has no where else to go.  This doctor could not even read details of my ultra sound so I had to rely on some random doctor (over the phone) to tell me that yes, I have a rather large stone.  This female gastro doc never made any follow up appointment with me.  I immediately canceled the surgery.  I have since discussed this decision with other doctors (ENT and family doctor) and they agree with my decision.  My one gallstone while big is not currently causing typical symptoms.  There is absolutely no guarantee that removal of my gallbladder will fix the acid reflux.  And, recently, my acid reflux has been manageable with a proper clean (and green) diet. Folks, after doing much research, I am convinced that probably millions of Americans have gallstones.  Why?  Diet, it's that simple.  Our diet is just too high in fat, salt, and sugar amongst other things.  A lot of people have gallstones without even knowing UNLESS they have a gallbladder attack that lands them in the ER (or in my case was found just by chance).  In my opinion, gallbladder pain and recurrent attacks are reasons to remove the gallbladder.  Yes, you can live without your gallbladder but you can also live without your arm.  Your body functions better with both so unless you are having issues, think really hard about whether it's worth losing an organ.  In very rare cases, gallbladder disease in the form of stones can lead to major illnesses like cancer.  However, IF you drastically improve your diet, I do believe you can control your destiny.  Remember, everything begins in the gut!  Obviously, I am not a medical doctor, so these opinions are my own.  My last words of advice: get 2 or 3 opinions and remember that doctors are in the business to make money.

name: tfrank thetank
text: Will NEVER go back to "Dr." Anderson. I hardly had an entire 2 minutes to explain to him what was going on before I was all of a sudden waking up in the recovery room. No courtesy to say "hey, were starting the anesthesia." He was interested in the colonoscopy and getting it over and never asked me the first important question. And the symptoms I tried to tell him with details, kept getting muffled out by him talking to other medical personnel in the room. No chance to let him know that I was interested in having an endoscopy as well because my symptoms don't even pertain to my large intestine and possibly not even the end of my small intestine. So now my symptoms are still present and have no follow up appointment with him. Instead, they tell my wife to make me an appointment with a refered family doctor an entire month away. Not to mention my colonoscopy appointment took almost 2 months until they could do it.  Wouldn't have wasted my 500.00 that my insurance wouldn't cover, if I would have known that it wouldn't help me get my foot in the door to the gastro office. So here I am at square one.

name: Pamela Morris
text: Everyone was polite.

name: Larry Martin
text: Very efficient and cordial.

name: James Rogers
text: How does one get these people on the phone to make an appointment? If there are no services up front, what kind of services can I expect the services to be upon arrival?

name: Zenobia Blackmon
text: Routine follow up visit that went well.

name: Barbara Bryant
text: Ashley was awesome!

name: Suzanne Burns
text: Jackie  has the patients  of an angel.

resp.text:
Ms. Burns,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review, and mentioning Jackie. You're right, she's always willing to listen and help!

name: Frank Rivers
text:
